Vitamin A:

Plays a crucial role in maintaining healthy skin, vision, and immune function. Sources: Carrots, sweet potatoes, spinach, mangoes, apricots.
 Vitamin C:

Important for the growth and repair of tissues, as well as immune function.
 Sources: Citrus fruits (oranges, lemons), strawberries, bell peppers, tomatoes.
 Vitamin D:

Essential for bone health and the absorption of calcium.
 Sources: Fortified dairy products, fatty fish (salmon, tuna), exposure to sunlight.

Calcium:

Vital for the development and maintenance of strong bones and teeth.
 Sources: Dairy products (milk, cheese, yogurt), leafy green vegetables, fortified plant-based milk.
 Iron:

Necessary for the formation of hemoglobin and preventing iron-deficiency anemia.
 Sources: Lean meats, poultry, fish, beans, lentils, fortified cereals.
 Zinc:

Supports growth, immune function, and wound healing.
 Sources: Meat, dairy products, nuts, seeds, whole grains.
 Folate (Vitamin B9):

Important for DNA synthesis and cell growth.
 Sources: Leafy green vegetables, legumes, fortified cereals.
 Vitamin B6:

Essential for brain development and function.
 Sources: Meat, fish, poultry, bananas, whole grains.
 Vitamin B12:

Crucial for nerve function and the production of red blood cells.
 Sources: Meat, fish, dairy products, eggs.
 Iodine:

Necessary for proper thyroid function and the production of thyroid hormones.
 Sources: Iodized salt, seafood, dairy products.
 Magnesium:

Important for muscle and nerve function, as well as bone health.
 Sources: Nuts, seeds, whole grains, leafy green vegetables.
 Omega-3 Fatty Acids:

Support brain development and may have anti-inflammatory effects
 Sources: Fatty fish (salmon, mackerel), flaxseeds, chia seeds, walnuts.
